title: Humic substances increase tomato tolerance to osmotic stress while modulating vertically transmitted endophytic bacterial communities.
authors: Lengrand S, Dubois B, Pesenti L, Debode F, Legr√®ve A
abstract: While humic substances (HS) are recognized for their role in enhancing plant growth under abiotic stress by modulating hormonal and redox metabolisms, a key question remains: how do HS influence the microbiota associated with plants? This study hypothesizes that the effects of HS extend beyond plant physiology, impacting the plant-associated bacterial community. To explore this, we investigated the combined and individual impacts of HS and osmotic stress on tomato plant physiology and root endophytic communities.
